title: Hickory
summary: Hickory is a common name for trees composing the genus Carya, which includes around 18 species.[2] Five or six species are native to China, Indochina, and India (Assam), as many as twelve are native to the United States, four are found in Mexico, and two to four are native to Canada.[3][4] A number of hickory species are used for products like edible nuts or wood.
